## RigidBody.addToSimulation() method

Adds the rigid body to a simulation.

**Signature:**

```typescript
addToSimulation(simulation: Simulation): void;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

simulation


</td><td>

[Simulation](./server.simulation.md)


</td><td>

The simulation to add the rigid body to.

\*\*Side effects:\*\* Creates the underlying physics body and registers child colliders.

\*\*Category:\*\* Physics


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

void

## Remarks

\*\*Child colliders:\*\* Also adds all pending child colliders to the simulation. After this call, the rigid body is simulated and can respond to forces.
